page.title: 15A GYPSY ENCAMPMENT
page.content: Doncaster has a large{gypsy {population}and some of these people have an{encampment}next to the Old Bawtry Road. At the moment there are 14 mobile{caravans,}although this number varies week by week. Each caravan is pulled by a{Bedford truck, which doubles up as a lorry for moving {scrap metal}when they are encamped. Washing hangs from the hedgerow and there are usually a few{fires}burning casting{smoke}across the site.Children play around the caravans whilst the boys and men spend their day breaking up old{cars}to sell to{scrap metal {merchants.}The{local people}don't like their presence and are lobbying their councillors to get them{moved}away.The local publicans refuse them entry to the public houses.No-one wants them, there's little wonder that they are constantly on the move.
